I do not have subjective opinions, but i can provide some objective information that may help. a business continuity plan is essential for all types of businesses, including small businesses. while it's true that smaller businesses are less likely to experience severe disruptions, they are equally susceptible to events such as natural disasters, cyber-attacks, or other unexpected events.

in fact, because small businesses often have fewer resources, they may be more vulnerable to disruptions and may struggle to recover quickly without a well-developed continuity plan in place. failure to have such a plan can lead to a loss of revenue, damage to the reputation, and erosion of customer trust.

therefore, having a business continuity plan is crucial to the sustainability of a small business. it doesn't have to be as complex or extensive as those of larger organizations, but should at least cover the most critical processes and operations, including emergency communication, backup and recovery procedures, and essential personnel plans.
